item.description:
For those who missed out on last week hike, here is your 2nd chance. After hours of doing research, I think this is the best hike for our group since a lot of us are beginners. It also has great reviews on Yelp. The weather looks good for this Saturday - no rain! We hope you can make it.

Below are the details:

Mount Major (1786 feet tall) is an easy hike located near Lake Winnipesauke in New Hampshire

Distance: 3 miles (round  trip)
Hike Time: 2 1/2 hours (round trip)

We'll have lunch and drinks at the top of the mountain.

 Driving direction:

Route 93 north to Exit 20
- Route 3 northeast
- Route 11 east (for about 11 miles).

- It is about a 2 hour drive from Boston

As always, you're responsible for your transportation. However, many of our members are very good at providing carpools. If you're getting a ride please make it convenience for the drivers and share the cost of gas and toll with them. Note where you are located (town/city) and which T stop you can meet someone at. And please contact each other thru PM when possible.

Carpool fee is $13 payable to the driver. 

 

Be at the parking lot at 11 and the hike will start at 11:15. (Please don't be late). The drive from Boston is about 2 hours, so please plan accordingly to be there on time.

Bring water, lunch, warm non-cotton clothes, hiking boots, snacks.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the parking lot near the hike entrance.

group.name: The Greater Boston Asian Professionals Meetup Group

item.name: Foliage Hike Mount Major
